intro: Trichostema arizonicum, commonly known as Arizona bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which are typically gray-green in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Trichostema arizonicum is a member of the Loasaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in native gardens.
